fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: Information technology -- Generic coding of moving pictures and associated audio information (formal name), MPEG-2 (common name), Main Profile
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: Permits the use of Intra-coded (I) frames, predicted (P) frames, and bidirectionally predicted (B) frames. Conformance points for this bitstream exist at the following levels: Low, Main, High-1440, and High. At the Main Level, the broadcast-stream picture size is 720x576 pixels (non-square pixels), with color sampling of 4:2:0 and a maximum data rate of 15 Mb/s.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Profile of MPEG-2 that permits the use of Intra-coded (I) frames, predicted (P) frames, and bidirectionally predicted (B) frames. Conformance points for this bitstream exist at the following levels: Low, Main, High-1440, and High. At the Main Level, the broadcast-stream picture size is 720x576 pixels (non-square pixels), with color sampling of 4:2:0 and a maximum data rate of 15 Mb/s.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Generally a final-state (end-user delivery) format; may be used as a middle-state (broadcast production) format.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: MPEG-2, Main Profile, with Layer II Audio Encoding

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: MPEG-2_MP (Main Profile) is used by broadcasters and cablecasters, who may also use MPEG-2_422 (4:2:2 Profile). The Vanderbilt University TV News Archive uses MPEG-2_MP when reformatting its analog videotapes and when making new off-air recordings.

fdd:movingImageQF.fdd:clarity: See MPEG-2. At a given picture size, data rate, and encoding algorithm, MPEG-2_MP (Main Profile) will produce greater clarity than MPEG-2_SP (Simple Profile) but less than MPEG-2_422 (4:2:2 Profile).

fdd:filenameExtension.fdd:note: There is no explicit MPEG-2 file format; MPEG-2 content "ready to be delivered" is exchanged in files with these extensions.
